translations.text: O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180354">1</sup> fear Allah and do not obey the unbelievers and the hypocrites. Verily Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="180355">2</sup>
Follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord. Verily Allah is fully aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="180356">1</sup>
Put your trust in Allah: Allah is sufficient as Guardian.<sup foot_note="180357">1</sup>

Allah has never put two hearts within one person's body;<sup foot_note="180358">1</sup> nor has He made your wives, whom you compare to your mothers' backs (to divorce them),<sup foot_note="180359">2</sup> your true mothers; nor has He made those whom you adopt as sons your own sons.<sup foot_note="180360">3</sup> These are only words that you utter with your mouths. But Allah proclaims the Truth and directs you to the Right Path.

Call your adopted sons after their true fathers; that is more equitable in the sight of Allah.<sup foot_note="180361">1</sup> But if you do not know their true fathers, then regard them as your brethren in faith and as allies.<sup foot_note="180362">2</sup> You will not be taken to task for your mistaken utterances, but you will be taken to task for what you say deliberately.<sup foot_note="180363">3</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="180364">4</sup>

Surely the Prophet has a greater claim over the believers than they have over each other,<sup foot_note="180365">1</sup> and his wives are their mothers.<sup foot_note="180366">2</sup> According to the Book of Allah, blood relatives have greater claim over each other than the rest of the believers and the Emigrants (in the cause of Allah), except that you may do some good to your allies (if you so wish).<sup foot_note="180367">3</sup> This is inscribed in the Book of Allah.

And call to mind, (O Prophet), when We took the covenant from all Prophets; and also from you and Noah and Abraham, Moses, and Jesus the son of Mary. We took from them a solemn covenant<sup foot_note="180368">1</sup>

so that (their Lord) may question the truthful about their truthfulness.<sup foot_note="180369">1</sup> As for the unbelievers, He has kept a painful chastisement in store for them.<sup foot_note="180370">2</sup>

Believers,<sup foot_note="180371">1</sup> call to mind Allah's favour to you when enemy hosts invaded you. Then We sent against them a wind and hosts that you did not see although<sup foot_note="180372">2</sup> Allah was observing all that you were then doing.

When they came upon you from above you and from below you,<sup foot_note="180373">1</sup> when your eyes were stupefied with horror and your hearts leapt to your throats, and you began to entertain diverse thoughts about Allah.
The believers were then put to a severe test and were most violently convulsed.<sup foot_note="180374">1</sup>
And call to mind when the hypocrites and all those with diseased hearts said: “All that Allah and His Messenger had promised us<sup foot_note="180375">1</sup> was nothing but deceit.”

And when a section of them said: “(O people of Yathrib), now there is no place for you to stay, so turn back.”<sup foot_note="180376">1</sup> (And call to mind) when a section of them was seeking permission from the Prophet to leave, saying: “Our houses are exposed (to attack),”<sup foot_note="180377">2</sup> although they were not exposed (to attack); <sup foot_note="180378">3</sup> they only wished to flee (from the battle-front).

If the enemy were to enter the town from various directions, and they were summoned to act treacherously,<sup foot_note="180379">1</sup> they would have succumbed to it and would have shown little reluctance in doing so.
They had earlier covenanted with Allah that they would not turn their backs in flight. And a covenant made with Allah must needs be answered for.<sup foot_note="180380">1</sup>
(O Prophet), tell them: “If you run away from death or slaying, this flight will not avail you. You will have little time after that to enjoy<sup foot_note="180381">1</sup> (the pleasures of life).”

Say (to them): “Who can protect you from Allah if He desires an evil for you? And who can prevent Him if He desires to show mercy to you?” They shall find none other than Allah to be their protector or helper.
Allah knows well those of you who create obstructions (in war efforts) and say to their brethren: “Come and join us.”<sup foot_note="180382">1</sup> They hardly take any part in battle.

They are utterly niggardly<sup foot_note="180383">1</sup> (in coming to your aid). Whenever there is danger, you will see them looking at you, their eyes rolling as though they were on the verge of fainting at the approach of death. But when the danger passes away, their greed for wealth prompts them to greet you with their sharp, scissor-like tongues.<sup foot_note="180384">2</sup> These are the ones who never truly believed, and so Allah has caused their deeds to be reduced to naught.<sup foot_note="180385">3</sup> That is easy enough for Allah.<sup foot_note="180386">4</sup>

They think that the invading confederates have not yet gone. But if the confederates were to mount another assault, they would wish to be in the desert among the bedouins and keep themselves informed about you from there. But even if they remained in your midst, hardly would they fight.

Surely there was a good example for you in the Messenger of Allah,<sup foot_note="180387">1</sup> for all those who look forward to Allah and the Last Day and remember Allah much.<sup foot_note="180388">2</sup>

As for the true believers,<sup foot_note="180389">1</sup> when they saw the invading confederates, they cried out: “This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and what Allah and His Messenger said was absolutely true.”<sup foot_note="180390">2</sup> This only increased their faith and submission. <sup foot_note="180391">3</sup>

Among the believers there are those who have remained true to the covenant they made with Allah. Among those some of them have fulfilled their vow and others await the appointed time.<sup foot_note="180392">1</sup> They have not changed in the least.

(All this is) in order that Allah may reward the truthful for their truthfulness, and either punish the hypocrites or, if He so wills, accept their repentance. Verily Allah is Most Pardoning, Most Compassionate.
Allah sent back the unbelievers empty-handed, their hearts seething with rage. Allah sufficed the believers in their fight. Allah is Most Powerful, Most Mighty.

Allah brought down from their fortresses those People of the Book who had supported the invading confederates<sup foot_note="180393">1</sup> and cast such terror into their hearts that some of them you kill and some of them you take captive.
Allah made you inherit their land, their dwellings, and their goods, and a piece of land on which you had not yet trodden. Verily Allah has power over all things.
O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180394">1</sup> tell your wives: “If you seek the world and its embellishments, then come and I will make some provision for you and release you in an honourable way.
But if you seek Allah and His Messenger and the Abode of the Hereafter, then surely Allah has prepared a great reward for those of you who do good.”<sup foot_note="180395">1</sup>
Wives of the Prophet, if any of you commit flagrant indecency, her chastisement shall be doubled.<sup foot_note="180396">1</sup> That is easy for Allah.<sup foot_note="180397">2</sup>
But whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does good deeds, Allah will double her reward.<sup foot_note="180398">1</sup> We have prepared for her a generous provision.

Wives of the Prophet, you are not like other women.<sup foot_note="180399">1</sup> If you fear Allah, do not be too complaisant in your speech lest those with diseased hearts should covet you; but speak in a straight forward manner.<sup foot_note="180400">2</sup>

And stay in your homes<sup foot_note="180401">1</sup> and do not go about displaying your allurements as in the former Time of Ignorance.<sup foot_note="180402">2</sup> Establish Prayer, give Zakah, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only wishes to remove uncleanness from you, O members of the (Prophet's) household, and to purify you completely.<sup foot_note="180403">3</sup>
Remember the Signs of Allah and the words of wisdom which are rehearsed in your homes.<sup foot_note="180404">1</sup> Verily Allah is All-Subtle,<sup foot_note="180405">2</sup> All-Aware.

Surely<sup foot_note="180411">1</sup> the men who submit (to Allah) and the women who submit (to Allah),<sup foot_note="180412">2</sup> the men who have faith and the women who have faith,<sup foot_note="180413">3</sup> the men who are obedient and the women who are obedient,<sup foot_note="180414">4</sup> the men who are truthful and the women who are truthful;<sup foot_note="180415">5</sup> the men who are steadfast and the women who are steadfast,<sup foot_note="180416">6</sup> the men who humble themselves (to Allah) and the women who humble themselves (to Allah),<sup foot_note="180417">7</sup> the men who give alms and the women who give alms,<sup foot_note="180418">8</sup> the men who fast and the women who fast,<sup foot_note="180419">9</sup> the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard their chastity,<sup foot_note="180420">10</sup> the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah much:<sup foot_note="180421">11</sup> for them has Allah prepared forgiveness and a mighty reward.<sup foot_note="180422">12</sup>

It<sup foot_note="180423">1</sup> does not behove a believer, male or female, that when Allah and His Messenger have decided an affair they should exercise their choice. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has strayed to manifest error.<sup foot_note="180424">2</sup>

(O Prophet),<sup foot_note="180425">1</sup> call to mind when you said to him<sup foot_note="180426">2</sup>whom Allah had favoured and you had favoured: “Cleave to your wife and fear Allah,”<sup foot_note="180427">3</sup> and you concealed within yourself for fear of people what Allah was to reveal, although Allah has greater right that you fear Him.<sup foot_note="180428">4</sup> So when Zayd had accomplished what he would of her,<sup foot_note="180429">5</sup> We gave her in marriage to you<sup foot_note="180430">6</sup> so that there should not be any constraint for the believers regarding the wives of their adopted sons after they had accomplished whatever they would of them.<sup foot_note="180431">7</sup> And Allah's command was bound to be accomplished.

There could be no hindrance to the Prophet regarding what Allah ordained for him.<sup foot_note="180432">1</sup> Such has been Allah's Way (with the Prophets) who went before. Allah's command is a decree firmly determined.<sup foot_note="180433">2</sup>
(This is Allah's Way) regarding those who deliver the Messages of Allah and who fear Him, and fear no one else than Allah. Allah is Sufficient as a Reckoner.<sup foot_note="180434">1</sup>
Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the seal of the Prophets. Allah has full knowledge of everything.<sup foot_note="180435">1</sup>
Believers, remember Allah much
and glorify Him morning and evening.<sup foot_note="180436">1</sup>

It is He Who lavishes His blessings on you and His angels invoke blessings on you that He may lead you out of darkness into light. He is Most Compassionate to the believers.<sup foot_note="180437">1</sup>
On the Day they meet Him they will be greeted with: “Peace.”<sup foot_note="180438">1</sup> He has prepared for them a generous reward.
O Prophet,<sup foot_note="180439">1</sup> We have sent you forth as a witness,<sup foot_note="180440">2</sup> a bearer of good tidings, and a warner,<sup foot_note="180441">3</sup>
as one who calls people to Allah by His leave,<sup foot_note="180442">1</sup> and as a bright, shining lamp.
Announce to the believers the good tidings that Allah has kept bounteous blessings in store for them.
Do not yield to the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard the hurt that comes from them, and put your trust in Allah. Allah suffices as the Guardian to entrust one's affairs to.

Believers, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them,<sup foot_note="180443">1</sup> you may not require them to observe a waiting period that you might reckon against them. So make provision for them and release them in an honourable manner.<sup foot_note="180444">2</sup>

O Prophet, We have made lawful for you your wives whose bridal dues you have paid,<sup foot_note="180445">1</sup> and the slave-girls you possess from among the prisoners of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and maternal aunts who have migrated with you, and a believing woman who gives herself to the Prophet and whom he wants to take in marriage.<sup foot_note="180446">2</sup> (O Prophet), this privilege is yours alone to the exclusion of other believers.<sup foot_note="180447">3</sup> We know well what restrictions We have imposed upon them as regards their wives and those whom their right hands possess, (and have exempted you from those restrictions) that there may be no constraint upon you.<sup foot_note="180448">4</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.

Of them you may put off any of them you wish, and you may take any of them whom you wish, and you may call back any of those whom you had (temporarily) set aside: there will be no blame on you (on this account). It is likelier that they will thus be comforted, and will not grieve, and every one of them will be well-pleased with what you give them.<sup foot_note="180449">1</sup> Allah knows what is in your hearts. Allah is All-Knowing, All-Forbearing.<sup foot_note="180450">2</sup>

Thereafter women will not be lawful for you, and it will not be lawful for you to take other wives in place of them, even though their beauty might please you,<sup foot_note="180406">1</sup>unless they be those whom your right hand owns.<sup foot_note="180407">2</sup> Allah is watchful over everything.

Believers, enter not the houses of the Prophet without his permission,<sup foot_note="180451">1</sup>nor wait for a meal to be prepared; instead enter when you are invited to eat,<sup foot_note="180452">2</sup> and when you have had the meal, disperse. Do not linger in idle talk.<sup foot_note="180453">3</sup> That is hurtful to the Prophet but he does not express it out of shyness; but Allah is not ashamed of speaking out the Truth. And if you were to ask the wives of the Prophet for something, ask from behind a curtain. That is more apt for the cleanness of your hearts and theirs.<sup foot_note="180454">4</sup> It is not lawful for you to cause hurt to Allah's Messenger,<sup foot_note="180455">5</sup> nor to ever marry his wives after him.<sup foot_note="180456">6</sup> Surely that would be an enormous sin in Allah's sight.
(It does not matter) whether you disclose something or conceal it, for Allah certainly knows everything.<sup foot_note="180457">1</sup>

It will not be blameworthy for the wives of the Prophet if their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons,<sup foot_note="180458">1</sup> and the women with whom they have social relations,<sup foot_note="180459">2</sup> and the persons whom their right hands possess enter their houses.<sup foot_note="180460">3</sup> (O women), shun disobeying Allah. Allah is watchful over everything.<sup foot_note="180461">4</sup>
Allah and His angels bless the Prophet.<sup foot_note="180462">1</sup> Believers, invoke blessings and peace on him.<sup foot_note="180463">2</sup>

Verily those who cause annoyance to Allah and His Messenger � Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a humiliating chastisement.<sup foot_note="180464">1</sup>
Those who cause hurt to believing men and to believing women have invited upon themselves a calumny<sup foot_note="180465">1</sup> and a manifest sin.

O Prophet, enjoin your wives and your daughters and the believing women, to draw a part of their outer coverings around them.<sup foot_note="180466">1</sup> It is likelier that they will be recognised and not molested.<sup foot_note="180467">2</sup> Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.<sup foot_note="180468">3</sup>

If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts there is a sickness,<sup foot_note="180469">1</sup> and the scandal mongers in Madinah<sup foot_note="180470">2</sup> do not desist from their vile acts, We shall urge you to take action against them, and then they will hardly be able to stay in the city with you.
They shall be cursed from all around and they shall be ruthlessly killed wherever they are seized.
This has been Allah's Way with those who have gone before, and you shall find no change in Allah's Way.<sup foot_note="180471">1</sup>
People ask you concerning the Hour (of Resurrection).<sup foot_note="180472">1</sup> Say: “Allah alone has knowledge of it. What do you know? Perhaps the Hour is nigh.”
Allah has cursed the unbelievers and has prepared for them a Blazing Fire;
therein they shall abide for ever. They shall find none to protect or help them.
On that Day when their faces shall be turned around in the Fire, they will say: “Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger.”
They will say: “Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones, and they turned us away from the Right Way.
Our Lord, mete out to them a double chastisement and lay upon them a mighty curse.”<sup foot_note="180473">1</sup>

Believers,<sup foot_note="180474">1</sup> do not be like those who distressed Moses and then Allah declared him quit of the ill they spoke about him; and he had a high standing with Allah.<sup foot_note="180475">2</sup>
Believers, fear Allah and speak the truth:
Allah will set your deeds right for you and will forgive you your sins. Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has achieved a great triumph.

We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to carry it and were afraid of doing so; but man carried it. Surely he is wrong-doing, ignorant.<sup foot_note="180476">1</sup>

(The consequence of man's carrying the trust is) that Allah may chastise hypocritical men and hypocritical women and accept the repentance of believing men and believing women. He is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
